com.gembox.spreadsheet

Class CsvLoadOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gembox.spreadsheet.LoadOptions
      • com.gembox.spreadsheet.CsvLoadOptions

  • public final class CsvLoadOptions
extends LoadOptions
    Represents options for loading from Character Separated Values file format.
    See Also:
    Open and read Excel file in Java, Convert Excel file to XLS, XLSX, ODS, CSV and HTML in Java

    • Method Detail

      • getCharset

        public Charset getCharset()
        Gets the charset for the CSV file.

      • getNumberStyles

        public NumberType getNumberStyles()
        Gets a value indicating numeric type used when parsing strings to numeric types.

        Default value is NumberType.DOUBLE

        See Also:
        NumberType

      • getParseLocale

        public Locale getParseLocale()
        Gets the locale for the CSV file.

      • getSeparator

        public char getSeparator()
        Gets character that serves as value delimiter.

      • getType

        public Optional<CsvType> getType()
        Gets value delimiter type, see CsvType.

      • hasFormulas

        public boolean hasFormulas()
        Gets a value indicating the text is formula if it starts with '='. Default value is false.

      • hasQuotedValues

        public boolean hasQuotedValues()
        Gets a value indicating whether values in CSV file can be quoted. Default value is true.

      • isAllowNewLineInQuotes

        public boolean isAllowNewLineInQuotes()
        Gets a value indicating whether a new line character can be inside quotes. Default value is true.

      • isParseNumbers

        public boolean isParseNumbers()
        Gets a value indicating whether numbers will be parsed and stored as double value when loading CSV file. If false, numbers will be loaded as strings. Default value is true.

      • setAllowNewLineInQuotes

        public void setAllowNewLineInQuotes(boolean allowNewLineInQuotes)
        Sets a value indicating whether a new line character can be inside quotes. Default value is true.

      • setCharset

        public void setCharset(Charset value)
        Sets the charset for the CSV file.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - Value is set to null.

      • setHasFormulas

        public void setHasFormulas(boolean hasFormulas)
        Sets a value indicating the text is formula if it starts with '='. Default value is false.

      • setHasQuotedValues

        public void setHasQuotedValues(boolean hasQuotedValues)
        Sets a value indicating whether values in CSV file can be quoted. Default value is true.

      • setNumberStyles

        public void setNumberStyles(NumberType numberType)
        Sets a value indicating numeric type used when parsing strings to numeric types.

        Default value is NumberType.DOUBLE

        See Also:
        NumberType

      • setParseLocale

        public void setParseLocale(Locale locale)
        Sets the locale for the CSV file.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - locale is set to null.

      • setParseNumbers

        public void setParseNumbers(boolean value)
        Sets a value indicating whether numbers will be parsed and stored as double value when loading CSV file. If false, numbers will be loaded as strings. Default value is true.

      • setSeparator

        public void setSeparator(char separator)
        Sets character that serves as value delimiter.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Value is set to quote '"' or new line '\n'.

      • setType

        public void setType(CsvType type)
        Sets value delimiter type, see CsvType.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - type is set to null.
